author: shirogat
title: Empower 400 Marginalized Girls
description: これらの少女や若い女性は、強制的な早婚、児童労働、ジェンダーに基づく暴力などの問題により、人生のチャンスが限られています。

f6_assessments.q0: この提案は、アフリカの疎外された少女400人に機能的なプログラミングの教育を受けさせ、カルダノブロックチェーンに触れさせることで、彼女たちの生活状況を変えるためのデジタル教育のアウトリーチ拠点を作ることを目的としています。このプロジェクトの目標と最終製品には、深い人道的基盤があり、他の多くの人々と同じ特権を持っていない世界中の人々に平等な機会を提供することを目指しています。このコンセプトは、（カルダノコミュニティでの私の経験では）カルダノのコアバリューと非常に一致しています。問題提起は、400人の疎外された人々に焦点を当て、彼らに教育を与え、より良い未来を提供することを目的としています。その内容は、提案書の説明では少し不明確ですが、いくつかの部分は非常に具体的です。例えば、インターネット、教材、教師の提供、デジタルハブの構築などは明確です。しかし、カリキュラムやこの教育に何が含まれているのかは、さらに具体的に示すことができるでしょう。教師としては、カリキュラムの例を説明の中に入れてほしかったですね。現時点では、この教育の目的が、参加者に関数型プログラミングの学習方法を教えることなのか、それともアニメの脚本を書くことなのかがわかりません。この点については、企画書やプロジェクトの理解度を高めるために、詳細な計画書に記載することが望ましいと思います。全体として、この提案が課題を効果的に解決しているとは言えず、賛成も反対もできません。
f6_assessments.q1: 提案書の中にコアチームについての情報があると、提案書に大きなメリットがあります。ケニア政府の青年省が（少女教育チャレンジプログラムのICT教育アドバイザーとともに）参加しているということは、意図したとおりにプロジェクトを完成させるための信頼性と能力が高いことを物語っています。残念ながら、提案書に書かれていることをさらに確認できる証拠はありません。少なくともコアチームのメンバーについては、チームの能力を確認できるようなリンク（LinkedInのプロフィール、以前のアフィリエイトプロジェクトなど）を提供していただけると幸いです。添付ファイルには、予算配分の優れた表が含まれていますが、これは私がコミュニティ・アドバイザーとして過去2回のファンドで見た中で最も優れたものです。合理的で詳細な内容となっています。また、カリキュラムや実際の教育の詳細を説明することで、提案書（「インパクト」で述べたように、プロジェクトをよりよく理解するために）必要な明確さが得られます。この提案が成功裏に実施されることについては、賛成も反対もしない。
f6_assessments.q2: 提案書には、エクセルシートによる明確なロードマップが含まれています（添付ファイルに記載）。いくつかのKPIが構造的かつ時系列的に提示されていますが、ここでは各KPIの詳細を提示することも有益でしょう。いくつかの数字を加えることで、提案書の明確性が増す可能性があります。例えば、このプロジェクトは同じ400人を対象にしているのでしょうか？その場合は、KPIではなく、ロードマップのマイルストーンの一部として成功の尺度を提示した方がわかりやすいでしょう。私が情報を誤解しているのかもしれませんが、プロジェクトが各KPIマイルストーンの後に400人の新しい参加者を見つけることを目的としているのかどうか、私には不明です。もし提案書に、このプロジェクトの開発中に起こりうる課題についての短い文章が含まれていれば、コミュニティ・アドバイザーとして、このプロジェクトを遂行するチームの信頼性と能力に対する信頼感が増すと思います。また、コミュニティがプロジェクトの進捗状況を確認できるように、ソーシャルチャンネルへのリンクを貼ることもできます。提供された情報が不足しているため、この提案が、掲げられた目標の達成状況を評価するのに十分な情報を提供しているとは思えません。

f6_assessments.q0: Many girls in the world today can't follow their dreams and are forced into early marriage, child labor, or suffer from gender-based violence. In order to address this problem, the team intends to establish model schools in marginalized areas of Kenya to provide functional programming training. The proposed goal and success metrics seem loosely aligned with this challenge, as the proposal is focused on increasing the odds of this group of girls achieving blockchain-related employment.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provides details on how the program would work, as well as some key aspects to understand its objectives. However, the information required to make a full assessment of the feasibility aspect of the project is still lacking. The proposal leader is described briefly in terms of his or her skills and experience, but no references are provided to verify these statements. The team has attached the budget, and after evaluating the items included, I must admit that I believe most of them to be appropriate except perhaps for the Plutus programmer. It is stated that $2600 will be allocated, but I am not sure what the role of the person will be. Is the person responsible for training the girls directly? If so, how much does each hour of training cost? Another aspect that I have missed here is the description of the risks that may threaten the successful implementation of this proposal. For instance, what is the expected dropout rate? And what measures is the team contemplating to reduce this risk?
f6_assessments.q2: The success metrics provided seem appropriate to the team's expectations (even though they are not conforming to the criteria for the challenge as noted in the impact section). In addition, the team has attached a document providing the necessary details for the implementation of this proposal, however, it appears to be an estimate from a previous proposal or project since they suggest a date between May and October 2021 for implementation. Based on the assumptions that the same logic of timing is followed from the date of the allocation of funds, the actions and times assigned seem appropriate.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal clearly addresses the problem being young women in Kenya having limited life due to forced early marriage and other issues. The proposal is trying to resolve the issue by creating a digital education outreach hub that would support 400 marginalized girls in Kenya by providing training. The proposal does address the issue.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer appears to be well versed with the requirements and has the essential expertise to make this proposal happen.
The proposal consists of a rough plan and benefits of this proposal but a detailed plan with a roadmap would have helped to increase the chances of successful implementation of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does come up with the possible KPIs that auditors can use to track the progress of the proposal but without a complete roadmap with a timeline and without a definition of success. It would be hard to track the development and the success of the proposal. Even a detailed fund allocation would have helped the auditors.

f6_assessments.q0: Even though the proposal is coping with a relevant problem, it is not placed in the right challenge. Therefore, it does not address the issues within the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget has no clarity and the proposer has given not enough info about relevant experience. Please consider detailing it accordingly to the proposer's guidelines: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oE_cnP0gksdAanXV4w5DYaDNp_tbYEvyHhTUG4HYZ3Q/edit
f6_assessments.q2: There are KPIs, but no roadmaps or any other means to audit the project execution. It's advisable bringing them in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of ​​the challenge is very good, to train young women from pastoral communities in Kenya with classes on technology issues, in order to generate a better insertion in the job market and so on. What worries me a little is that the theory is perfect, but I don't really understand how that would be done in practice. It is not detailed in the proposal things like: what content of these workshops; in which schools (or universities, but I believe schools - which would also be a problem, because this type of teaching is a little difficult and advanced for those in elementary and high school. who are already dependent on the world of technologies, at least ); who would give these classes, how would the training of professionals be carried out; how often these classes would take place; how success would be measured, that is, how common taught women get inserted into the Cardano ecosystem, so as to measure the proposed benefits for the blockchain... Too many details. I'm also a little worried because it's such an ambitious idea to introduce the blockchain into a community that, unfortunately, gives so few opportunities to study and work for women. Maybe it would be more important to guarantee primary education to then invest in something more specific, you know? It worries me if this idea, despite being wonderful in theory, in practice is viable for the current situation in which these women find themselves. It is indisputable how we need to invest in their education, but I don't know if that would be the way at the moment.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, we have almost no information on this research topic. Starting with the team, we don't know who they are, what they do, what their relationship is with the Cardano ecosystem, a small curriculum of what they did before, because they would be qualified to execute this project, in particular. It would be important to present them individually, to say their names, maybe their social media profiles and all that information I mentioned. Nor is anything said about how the financing money would be used. Why 30k? It would be necessary to understand what kind of expenses this would cover: teachers' salaries, their qualifications? Space rental? Transport and food for students? A monetary incentive to take the course? Disclosure costs...? There is no way for us to understand the need for such financing if nothing is explained to us. And about the script, we also don't have any kind of division of stages, phases that together would result in the project completed and the objectives achieved. It would be important that we were informed which activities would be carried out, in which order, by whom and why (and that each one was properly detailed). Unfortunately, the author of the proposal spends a lot of time explaining why the project would be important and what the expected results are, but does not explain at any point the process that would lead to this. We have a very superficial notion of what would happen based on the expected results: the organization of classes, teacher training, contact with students and so on. But without the exhibition of activities, there is no way to visualize the development of all this.
f6_assessments.q2: This is without a doubt the most complete part of the proposal. Many KPIs are enumerated so we have plenty of information to understand what is being expected and details of possible outcomes. This makes the proposal easily auditable because there is content to be monitored. It would be even better if there were a detailed roadmap here (that way we could analyze the process, not just the end) and also a budget breakdown so that we could monitor whether the money was being used as promised. I believe it would be essential for the team to partially present the results to the community. I think this is because there are numerous KPIs, so it would not be advisable to measure everything at once. Here we do not have a temporal notion of how long this project would take to develop as a whole, but we could think, for example, of a monthly follow-up from the community to the project, together with the team. It would also be interesting if, for example, the results of these teachings in the lives of young women were evaluated. Did they get opportunities from the project? How was the impact? This information could be organized and reported to the rest of the community, through Town Hall, for example. If successful, this project would be achieving many of the Cardano ecosystem's objectives: it would bring people together around the subject (forming a hub), bring new members to the community (which relates to the challenge of f6 "value on boarding") and also would benefit Africa (meeting the challenge of f5 and f6 "grow Africa, grow Cardano).

f6_assessments.q0: This seems to be a meaningful idea to the world community in general, and the blockchain community in particular. However, I suggest you go ahead and provide more information on how you would promote cardano blockchain education. any? you add the accompanying teaching materials will be better.
f6_assessments.q1: in terms of the meaning of this proposal it is very good. but i see that the presentation team has not produced any authentic documents, i have a few questions and questions for the group. like the documents go what about included? about the stated experience statements of the group I think I should add more solid evidence to prove the experience of the proposed group. You have not specified who the number of group members includes?. What is the route you need to take? I suggest that the budget should be broken down into sections to make it easier to audit. I regret that the impact of the project is quite high, but the presentation of the proposal lacks a lot of content, I hope the proposal team will take a look. review and finalize the proposal next time
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is missing a lot of important information, such as a roadmap, important milestones such as time to achieve results. What steps do you plan to take to move towards your success? .with the capital raising amount of 30000 USD, how will it be used? I am quite sorry that the proposed team has not provided enough transparent information. I hope that next time the team will add more so that the community appreciates the transparency of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: the proposal accurately identifies the challenge and seeks to aid in a fully globalised ecosystem by aiding marginalised woman and  girls in rural areas develop the necessary blockchain. The metrics align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team appears to have the requisite experience however without external links it is difficult to fact check. The funds require a more in depth breakdown as to where and how exactly they will be distributed due to the large number requested. without a timeframe it is difficult to determine feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs are provided and are measurable however there is a lack of roadmap and timeframe that needs to be referenced in order to ensure the project stays on track.

solution: ケニアの牧畜民コミュニティに住む、社会から疎外された400人の少女たちのトレーニングを支援するデジタル教育アウトリーチ・ハブの設立
experience: ケニア政府 青年・ICT省 DFiD女子教育チャレンジプログラム 教育アドバイザー ICT担当
